statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Providence 61, DePaul 60
article.story: ROSEMONT, Ill. (AP) -- Sharaud Curry's jumper with 10.7 seconds left gave Providence a 61-60 victory over DePaul on Tuesday night. Trailing 60-59, Curry juked DePaul's Jabari Currie to free himself for the game-winning shot. DePaul's Sammy Mejia missed a shot in the paint with 2 seconds to go. DePaul fouled Herbert Hill, who missed the front end of a 1-and-1, but the Blue Demons weren't able to convert a full court inbounds play with just under a second left. Hill had 20 points for the Friars (11-10, 4-6 Big East), while Donnie McGrath added 17 and Curry 10. McGrath scored on a drive to tie the game at 59 with 1:25 remaining. On the other end, Marlon Brumfield hit one of two free throws to give the Blue Demons a 60-59 lead. Mejia led DePaul (9-12, 2-8) with 17 points, but was just 2-of-6 from the free throw line. DePaul, which led most of the second half, extended its lead to 59-52 on Wilson Chandler's dunk with 4:59 left. Curry hit a 3 and Geoff McDermott added another basket to cut the Blue Demons' lead to 59-57 with 3:55 left. DePaul shot 65.4 percent against Providence's 2-3 zone in the first half, which saw 10 lead changes, and led 40-37. Mejia scored 13 points in the first half on 6-of-10 shooting and Karron Clarke added eight points. Clarke finished with 11. Hill scored 14 points in the half for Providence on 6-of-9 shooting.
